ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Detailed introductions to various deep learning models, hand-on practice constructing and training models
GANs, Autoencoder, Transformer
Detailed skills related to deep learning
Deep Learning.
PYTORCH  + NN stuff

How neural networks work in depth (backpropagation, perceptrons, activations etc.), the different types of neural network architectures out there (RNN, CNN, etc.), helpful theory such as generalization and universality of neural networks.

This course taught me a ton about deep learning architectures and their applications. I was able to acquire the skills to create simple models on my own in PyTorch, and the foundations that will enable me to go forward and learn more if I so desire!
I learned a survey of Deep Learning theory.

I got a really good understanding of the specific architectures of neural networks, before this class I was interested in deep learning but did not know where to start. This is an amazing crash course and now I am comfortable implementing them myself.
Various deep learning algorithms (in theory and implementation)
Practical knowledge of deep learning.
Survey course on methods used in AI, from graph search algos to NNs. Very superficial and fast
Deep learning knowledge and pytorch
Various deep learning models
I learned a lot about many deep learning methods. Additionally, working through the final project helped give me more practical experience with deep learning.
Deep learning frameworks and methods

Neural Networks, Gradient Descent and Backpropagation, regularization, generalizability and mathematical properties of neural nets and their loss landscapes, Sequential models (RNNs, LSTMs), Generative models (GANs, VAEs), auto-encoders. Dimensionality reduction, GNNs, Neural ODEs, etc.
Deep learning techniques and architectures
I've learned the basic types of deep learning networks, including CNN, RNN, and cutting-edge ones, such as transformer, and GAN.  I also learn how to build a network from the beginning.

A lot of valuable information. It moved very quickly. IT the only class I have seen, Yale or otherwise, that can take you from a basic understanding of ML and deep learning to understanding and implementing cutting edge models in a single semester.
Basic concept and hands-on experience with the deep learning field.
Basic knowledge of deep learning. Learned how to build fully connected neural network, auto encoder, CNN, VAE, and GAN using pytorch.
The basics of deep learning and many new ideas that happen in really recent years.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Some homework assignments are not stated clearly.
Very good course
NA due to auditing

The course is well organized.

The workload is really really challenging.

Strengths: very interesting course, engaging homeworks, can work on a cool project with other people
Weaknesses: N/A
The assignments were the highlight of the course.
A lot of base knowledge is assumed, the required level of linear algebra / calculus / fourier transform things should be clarified but otherwise a very interesting course

I really enjoyed the final project at the end of the course! I also enjoyed that there was no midterm and a take home final and the structure/timing of the problem sets. I felt that the assignments were well geared towards the course content.

Strengths: Great instructor, huge improvement from last semester.

Weaknesses: None
I think its great in terms of teaching,assignments ,TA and workload. But the final project should be allowed to individual work. And the Professor pay too much attention on the graphy neural network.
The concepts were important but how Smita explained was not very clear.

Strengths: Very interesting material, TAs and professor are very helpful

Weaknesses: I think that the feedback on assignments comes back relatively slowly

This course was great in many ways! It was a great, well-rounded intro to deep learning not only as it is used in various applications, but also some of the theory behind deep learning architectures. The course is also very up to date, with a portion of the content being developments within the last year or two. The only potential weakness I could say is that there is a significant gap between when the material is taught and when it appears on Psets, but in a way, this helped reinforced what we learned.
Good survey course of deep learning material. TAs and ULAs were very supportive throughout. Course structure and pace could be improved.

Strength: the course almost covers all the types of deep learning networks. I think whatever I'm going to use in the future, I could find related knowledge from this course. 
Weakness: introduction of some of the networks is not thoroughly
One weakness is that the communication between student and TA are lacking. There's no reply for the emails.

Abundant course materials. 
Teaching fellows are very supportive.

The lecture slides are a little messy.

Strengths: Each week there is a unique topic of DL, and some of them are really new topics that happen in recent years. 

Weakness: No weakness in my view!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes
Yes
I had taken a couple ML courses I still found this hard, the disconnect between the class and the hw makes it so that you spend 30+ hours on each hw. Nevertheless, it is very rewarding

I would definitely recommend this course to a student interested in machine learning. I would however recommend that they already have good fundamentals in machine learning/linear algebra before taking this class as this class can be quite challenging for someone new to machine learning. The class was very interesting and a student can learn a lot about neural networks in this course.
Not for students who are totally new to deep learning, but for those who already have a background and want to go further or do some research work.
Yes! If you are interested in deep learning and are willing to put in the work to understand some sometimes pretty mathematically intensive content, I think you can learn a lot!
Yes.
I would recommend this course for its challenge and range of interesting topics discussed.
Definitely if you are interested in neural networks
Yes! Especially to students interested in ML.
Yes, you learn a lot.

I feel as if I did not learn much from this course. It's good to get an overview of fields that you might want to dive in more deeply later on. Exams are written to trick students, mostly, and do not really test knowledge that has any intrinsic value other than duviding those who took notes about the smallest things said in lecture from those who did not. 

Professor Scaz is, however, engaging and very dedicated to the field, which is apparent in the way he teaches the class. I would suggest to take a class tought by him, just maybe not this one.
Yes! Taking this course and you can learn the whole development history  of deep learning .
I would if the student is already familiar with deep learning or very interested in it.
Yes, the course is very interesting and goes over a wide variety of areas in deep learning that you might use.
Yes, I think this course is really useful to build DL foundations

Yes, but be aware of the time commitment! I took this with no prior CS experience, and despite the challenges it worked out! The Psets are challenging, but there are only 4. The take home final is reasonable, but keep in mind the final project is a bit involved.
Not unless the student already had significant prior knowledge of machine learning techniques.

yes if that student is new to deep learning and would like to use deep learning in their own project in the future. This course is helpful for me to learn all the basic knowledge in this field and also some advanced development.
No.
Yes, the DL techniques are very useful.
